Class TreeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • TreeUtil
  • public class TreeUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    TreeUtil contains the following methods for manipulating binary trees: find the leftmost and rightmost nodes of the tree find the maximum depth of a tree create a random tree of a specified depth count the number of nodes or leaves in the tree visit the values of a binary tree in preorder, inorder, or postorder represent tree in a linear form (in a list) save given tree in a file builds tree given a linear representation of the tree read a file name and builds a tree based on the file's contents plays a game of twenty questions with the user make a duplicate of a tree determine if two trees have the same shape create morse tree decode morse code
    Version:
    12/3/21
    Author:
    Melody Yin

      • createRandom

        public static TreeNode createRandom​(int depth)
        create a random tree of the specified depth. No attempt to balance tree is provided.
        Parameters:
        depth - the depth of the tree
        Returns:
        a reference that points to the generated tree

        public static void preOrder​(TreeNode t,
                            TreeDisplay display)
        puts values of binary tree into preorder: root, left, right
        Parameters:
        t - the parent node of tree
        display - the graphic display for the process

      • fillList

        public static void fillList​(TreeNode t,
                            java.util.List<java.lang.String> list)
        takes in list of strings and fills list with contents of tree, including $ markers this should follow a preorder logic: root, left, right
        Parameters:
        t - the root of the tree
        list - the list to be filled with the tree's contents

      • saveTree

        public static void saveTree​(java.lang.String fileName,
                            TreeNode t)
        saveTree uses the FileUtil utility class to save the tree rooted at t as a file with the given file name
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file to create which will hold the data values in the tree
        t - the root of the tree to save

      • buildTree

        public static TreeNode buildTree​(java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> it)
        buildTree takes in an iterator which will iterate through a valid description of a binary tree with String values. Null nodes are indicated by "$" markers
        Parameters:
        it - the iterator which will iterate over the tree description
        Returns:
        the pointer to the root of the tree built by the iteration

      • loadTree

        public static TreeNode loadTree​(java.lang.String fileName)
        read a file description of a tree and then build the tree
        Parameters:
        fileName - is a valid file name for a file that describes a binary tree
        Returns:
        a pointer to the root of the tree

      • twentyQuestions

        public static void twentyQuestions()
        Plays a game of 20 questions. Begins by reading in a starting file and then plays multiple rounds until the user enters "quit". The final tree is then saved.

      • copy

        public static TreeNode copy​(TreeNode t)
        copy a binary tree
        Parameters:
        t - the root of the tree to copy
        Returns:
        a new tree, which is a complete copy of t with all new TreeNode objects pointing to the same values as t (in the same order, shape, etc)

      • sameShape

        public static boolean sameShape​(TreeNode t1,
                                TreeNode t2)
        tests to see if two trees have the same shape, but not necessarily the same values. Two trees have the same shape if they have TreeNode objects in the same locations relative to the root
        Parameters:
        t1 - pointer to the root of the first tree
        t2 - pointer to the root of the second tree
        Returns:
        true if t1 and t2 describe trees having the same shape, false otherwise

      • createDecodingTree

        public static TreeNode createDecodingTree​(TreeDisplay display)
        Generate a tree for decoding Morse code
        Parameters:
        display - the display that will show the decoding tree
        Returns:
        the decoding tree

      • decodeMorse

        public static java.lang.String decodeMorse​(TreeNode decodingTree,
                                           java.lang.String cipherText,
                                           TreeDisplay display)
        decodes Morse code by walking the decoding tree according to the input code
        Parameters:
        decodingTree - is the Morse code decoding tree
        cipherText - is Morse code consisting of dots, dashes, and spaces
        display - is the display object that will show the decoding progress
        Returns:
        the string represented by cipherText
